intro: Sterculia holtzei, commonly known as the African hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers that range in color from white to pink and yellow. Its leaves are typically large, heart-shaped, and have a rough texture. Sterculia holtzei is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its striking blooms and adaptability to various soil types.
